alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 26 at 8:37PM MST until January 27 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 MPH with gusts up to 65 MPH possible. Areas of blowing and drifting snow reducing visibilities to one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County including Bordeaux along Interstate 25 between Chugwater and Wheatland. * WHEN...Until 3 PM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. Hazardous travel conditions due to icy, snow covered roads and significantly reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow.
info.instruction: A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or more can lead to property damage.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County
